content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

In Julia, you can solve this problem by using a list comprehension to filter out words that don't start with an uppercase letter. Here is the function:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    [word for word in words if isupper(first(word))]
end
```
This function uses `isupper` to check whether the first character of a word is an uppercase letter and `first` to get the first character. It then returns a new list that contains only those words which meet this condition, effectively removing any words that don't start with a capital letter.
